meanings.definition: A young child or infant who is still nursing.
meanings.sent1: The little sucklings were all asleep in their cribs.
meanings.sent2: The mother cat took care of her sucklings with great love.
meanings.sent3: The baby sucklings giggled as they nursed, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her love for her children was like a warm embrace, nurturing them like sucklings.
meanings.sent5: The nurse gently cradled the sucklings, ensuring they were well cared for.

meanings.definition: The act of nursing or sucking at the breast.
meanings.sent1: The sucklings of the puppies was a heartwarming sight.
meanings.sent2: The sucklings of the baby lambs were a sign of new life on the farm.
meanings.sent3: The sucklings of the kittens were so eager, they almost made a game out of it.
meanings.sent4: The sucklings of the piglets were a symphony of contentment in the barn.
meanings.sent5: The sucklings of the calves were a reminder of the cycle of life on the ranch.

meanings.definition: A person or animal that sucks or feeds at the breast.
meanings.sent1: The little squirrel was a sucklings, seeking nourishment from its mother.
meanings.sent2: The baby bird was a sucklings, chirping eagerly for food.
meanings.sent3: The sucklings of the puppies was a comical sight as they all clamored for milk.
meanings.sent4: The sucklings of the kittens were like a chorus of tiny meows in the barn.
meanings.sent5: The sucklings of the piglets were a noisy bunch, but oh so adorable.
